description:
cmd/go: change default naming convention of 'go build'

this is done to preserve the behaviour of the old Makefile approach,
where running gomake in the directory of a command would
build it locally with the name given by TARG in the Makefile

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

Thanks, but this was an explicit change compared to
the current system.  Using a fixed name makes it easier
to write .(hg/git/svn)ignore files and to clean things up,
and a.out has a long and distinguished history as the
fixed name.

Of course, the -o flag gives you control over the name when
the default is not appropriate.

Russ

On Mon, Jan 9, 2012 at 23:06, sanjay.m <balasanjay@gmail.com> wrote:
> Not quite sure how to abandon a CL, but I closed it.

good enough, thanks.  for future reference, hg change -d.

On 2012/01/09 16:28:14, rsc wrote:
> Thanks, but this was an explicit change compared to
> the current system.  Using a fixed name makes it easier
> to write .(hg/git/svn)ignore files and to clean things up,
> and a.out has a long and distinguished history as the
> fixed name.
> 
> Of course, the -o flag gives you control over the name when
> the default is not appropriate.
> 
> Russ

Understood

Sanjay

Not quite sure how to abandon a CL, but I closed it.

Sanjay

subject: code review 5503088: cmd/go: change default naming convention of 'go build'
